p: GC-FID/MS analysis for the EO of Soo gave 11 natural compounds totaling 99.97%. EO of Soo was characterized by a high percentage of aldehydes (88.6%), with capronaldehyde (37.01%), 2( E )-hexenal (23.19%) pelargonaldehyde (19.05%), and decane (9.03%) as the major constituents. The terpene-type compound was not detected in the essential oil ofthe Soo. The composition of EO of Soo differed from that of EO of the other Serapias species. The main represented volatile compounds were reported to be saturated hydrocarbons (53.29%) in EO of S. vomeracea and pentacosane (17.59%); n -tricosane (14.21%), n -heneicosane (5.68%), and n -heptacosane (4.99%) were the most abundant compounds from the Italian orchid [18].
